Comment: [Here is the C-Span version](https://www.c-span.org/program/news-conference/attorney-general-bondi-holds-news-conference-on-drug-enforcement-efforts/659533)  TLDW - they found lots of drugs labeled as one thing but laced with fentanyl. And be aware that illicit drugs could have fentanyl .  They seized 11.5 kilos (25 lbs) of fentanyl including **3 million fentanyl pills marked as Oxycodone** - the fentanyl was in various amounts. The drugs were located in Phoenix, Albuquerque, and (sic) Utah.  From the Sinaloa organization. The lead was in Salem, Oregon, where they found 5 million dollars in cash.   They found 35 kilos (77 lbs) of methamphetamine, 7.5 kilos (16 lbs) of cocaine, 4 kg (9 lbs) of heroin, 49 rifles and pistols.   So - if you or your kids are in **Phoenix or Albuquerque or Utah (or Salem, Oregon)** - heads up on the safety of street drugs. They didn't list other places where the group sold drugs.

Comment: There's a lot of angst there... But... Yeah. In the last 60 years, Americans have bought into the following toxic ideas:  - Self sufficiency is a virtue -- meaning we are unwilling to ask for help for we don't need it. - The primacy of the nuclear family -- meaning we are unwilling to ask for help for we have everything we need from our partners and we must make it work. - Protestant work ethic -- meaning we are unwilling to ask for help for we just need to work harder. - American Exceptionalism -- meaning we are unwilling to ask for help for we are perfect.   Guess what? We need help.. but drugs will also work.
